approvals.title: ArgumentError: wrong number of arguments (given 2, expected 3) in dev environment

bibdata.title: Update Augment the Subject List with new Recommendations

comments.body:
@minjiec - Is the line below correct? It seems like maybe anything with "Koniagmiut Eskimos" should include the "Indigenous Studies" subject heading?
```
Koniagmiut Eskimos—Anthropometry	y	[150]	650	Koniagmiut Eskimos ǂx Anthropometry
```

@maxkadel Thank you for the sharp eye! Yes, "Koniagmiut Eskimos—Anthropometry" is apparently redundant, because "Koniagmiut Eskimos" is already listed in the spreadsheet. Somehow the string escaped my filter...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54282275/179063786-3f077e4a-932f-40d8-91d3-9d4e01aa6e6d.png)

It's going through this code path because it gets
`HTTP GET for https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/5b1c290b-2149-4ad1-8104-a85d28e9ef33.jsonld?auth_token=[redacted] failed with 406` at 
https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/blob/29df16583025e5406c49dde5fde3cadf8098ce62/app/values/manifest_metadata.rb#L28

In my browser I don't get this error from Figgy.

and then it goes down this code path that resulted in the error, via https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/blob/29df16583025e5406c49dde5fde3cadf8098ce62/app/values/manifest_metadata.rb#L119

We should figure out which of these things to try and fix.

figgy.title: Set cache_template_loading to true during testing

comments.body:
Same issue with

```
/mnt/hydra_sources/archives_bd/bcadmin/mss/av_backlog/C1436/C1436_2022_06_bag_a
```

Kelly says the pbcore may have a `pbcoreTitle[@titleType="item_title"]` instead.

At least one of these "from inside Blacklight" deprecations is in response to parameters we pass. 

https://github.com/projectblacklight/blacklight/blob/v7.28.0/lib/blacklight/parameters.rb#L84-L89

also at /home/circleci/figgy/app/views/base/_structure_node.html.erb:25) 

Note I fixed this deprecation in another location as part of https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/5244

friends_of_pul.title: Comment Form is Getting Spammed many times a day

comments.body: Looks like rails-html-sanitizer is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

Seems to be behaving fine locally:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45948126/179033181-a81e3bdf-6230-40a8-8b5f-5a29bc037ac3.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45948126/179033259-abf8927c-6b79-4f52-b65c-f32cdf4afb46.png)

Yes, we don't have a staging environment for this application. With the test suite in good shape and your local looking good I think we can go ahead to production. If there is an odd issue that comes we can roll back.
closed by #12
Looks like rails-html-sanitizer is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
This was due to testing a branch. Closing.

pdc_describe.title: Rename and test route to retrieve datacite xml serialization

comments.body: Breadcrumb: https://github.com/voxpupuli/json-schema

I can confirm that I am having difficulties with finding these exact metrics as well. Further, the logrotate configuration seems to be valid:

```bash
pulsys@pdc-discovery-prod1:/var/log$ cat /etc/logrotate.d/pdc_discovery
# Default logrotate configuration for a Rails App in Ansible managed

/opt/pdc_discovery/current/log/*.log {
  minsize 500M
  daily
  rotate 5
  copytruncate
  delaycompress
  compress
  notifempty
  missingok
  su root root
}
```

rdss-catchall.title: Product Owner training recommendations for RDSS

comments.body:
Possibilities so far - 
* [https://www.scrumalliance.org/get-certified/product-owner-track/certified-scrum-product-owner](https://www.scrumalliance.org/get-certified/product-owner-track/certified-scrum-product-owner)
* [https://jeffgothelf.com/self-paced-courses/](https://jeffgothelf.com/self-paced-courses/)
* [https://www.coursera.org/learn/introduction-to-certified-scrum-master](https://www.coursera.org/learn/introduction-to-certified-scrum-master)
* Pluralsight
  * [https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/becoming-great-product-owner](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/becoming-great-product-owner)
  * [https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/product-owner-fundamentals-foundations](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/product-owner-fundamentals-trenches)
  * [https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/understanding-your-product](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/understanding-your-product)
  * [https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/understanding-lean-value-driven-delivery](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/understanding-lean-value-driven-delivery)  
* EDUCAUSE Learning Lab series (August 2022) [https://events.educause.edu/courses/2022/creative-collaboration-the-power-of-team-based-problem-solving](https://events.educause.edu/courses/2022/creative-collaboration-the-power-of-team-based-problem-solving)
* [https://productmanagerhq.com/product-management-certifications/product-owner-certification-course/](https://productmanagerhq.com/product-management-certifications/product-owner-certification-course/)
* [https://scaledagile.com/training/safe-product-owner-product-manager/](https://scaledagile.com/training/safe-product-owner-product-manager/)
